radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed tomography (CT) of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Circumferential, moderate thickening of a long segment of the colonic wall at the hepatic flexure and adjacent mesenteric lymphadenopathy (largest lymph node measuring 1.2 cm in diameter), with no surrounding fat stranding. No dilated loops of bowel to suggest bowel obstruction.
Normal bowel-gas pattern and no dilated loops of bowel.

Circumferential, marked thickening of a long segment of the colonic wall at the hepatic flexure and adjacent mesenteric lymphadenopathy. Increased blood flow in the affected segment of the colon detected via color Doppler imaging.
